discussion.content: A and C are correct answers

questions.question_text: What are two security features enabled by default by the Autonomous Database? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Read Only access to OS Audit logs

questions.answer_description:
Oracle Data Pump provides very fast bulk data movement between Oracle Databases and Autonomous Data.
Reference:
https://k21academy.com/1z0-931/migrate-database-to-oracle-autonomous-database-cloud-options-data-pump-sql-loader-dbms_cloud-goldengate/

choices.B: Physical migration method like database cloning

questions.question_text: Which method can be used to migrate on-premises databases to Autonomous Databases in cloud?

questions.answer_description:
A region is a localized geographic area, and an availability domain is one or more data centers located within a region.
Because availability domains do not share infrastructure such as power or cooling, or the internal availability domain network, a failure at one availability domain within a region is unlikely to impact the availability of the others within the same region.
Reference:
https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/General/Concepts/regions.htm
questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: A and B are the correct answers

choices.B: Because availability domains do not share infrastructure such as power or cooling, or the internal availability domain network, a failure at one availability domain within a region is unlikely to impact the availability of the others within the same region.
choices.A: An OCI region is a localized geographic area, and an availability domain is one or more data centers located within a region.
choices.D: Regions are dependent on other regions and must be located with 5 thousand kilometers of each other.
choices.C: A single fault domain can be associated with multiple regions and availability domains.

choices.A: through the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service console

questions.question_text: Which two methods can you use to create users and grant roles in Autonomous Database services? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
correct answer: B, D

B & D. "To create users in your database, connect to the database as the ADMIN user using any SQL client tool."

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-data-warehouse-cloud/user/manage-users-create.html#GUID-54CA837B-CD6A-4ED2-A960-5874535818CB
B, C are the correct ones
B and D are correct as a sql client tool is required for the purpose
I agree with B and D too
